meanings.definition: Able to be encompassed or surrounded
meanings.sent1: The small garden was compassable by a fence.
meanings.sent2: The town was compassable by a river on one side.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle was so easy, it was compassable in just a few minutes.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was a compassable trait that everyone admired.
meanings.sent5: The concept was made more compassable with the help of visual aids.

meanings.definition: Capable of being navigated or traveled around
meanings.sent1: The mountain was not compassable due to the dangerous terrain.
meanings.sent2: The forest was compassable with the help of a detailed map.
meanings.sent3: The maze was so confusing that it was not compassable by anyone.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a compassable labyrinth of thoughts and ideas.
meanings.sent5: The journey became more compassable once they found a reliable guide.
